author: AraHaan
body: ## Steps to reproduce - Download the mac x64 pkg installer from the github releases tab to powershell 7.2 preview 4 on a mac with Big Sur. - go to the downloads and double click to try to install it. ## Expected behavior To be able to install the latest preview version of powershell core. ## Actual behavior This gets displayed instead of being able to install: ## Environment data Unable to provide powershell environment data without being able to install powershell.

comments.author: AraHaan
comments.body: The issue seems to be that the tag releases do not get signed by microsoft like the .NET Core / .NET SDK and runtime installers for Mac do.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Unless it changed significantly for Big Sur, on Mac you should be able to open it from the right-click context menu instead, which forces MacOS to actually let you pick whether you want to install it or not, instead of just refusing to let you do anything.

But yeah, GH pkg releases should probably be signed if there's any way to make that happen.

title: Cannot install powershell 7.2  preview 4 on Big Sur via github releases
